title: TREASURIES-U.S. bond yields pare fall after Jan U.S. consumer data
text: March 1, 2018 / 1:43 PM / Updated an hour ago TREASURIES-U.S. bond yields pare fall after Jan U.S. consumer data Reuters Staff 1 Min Read NEW YORK, March 1 (Reuters) - U.S. Treasury yields pared their early decline on Thursday as data showed the biggest monthly rise in domestic core consumer prices in a year, which was offset by a slowdown in consumer spending in January. At 8:39 a.m. (1339 GMT), benchmark 10-year Treasury yield was 2.846 percent, down 2.2 basis points from late on Wednesday. It fell to a two-week low of 2.824 percent earlier Thursday, Reuters data showed. (Reporting by Richard Leong)
